Sat Feb 08 01:56:48 +0000 2020

Replying to @jtgreene, @m0mus, @javahippie, @Camunda, @QuarkusIO and @MicroProfileIO

In addition, we only ever discussed passing MP spec TCKs. It‚Äôs worth remembering when this started it was not possible for vendors to run base spec TCKs from Java EE as it required a license. That would‚Äôve been too restricting to non vendors creating an MP implementation

Sun Feb 09 18:22:18 +0000 2020

Replying to @reza_rahman, @m0mus, @jtgreene, @javahippie, @Camunda, @QuarkusIO, @MicroProfileIO, @kwsutter and @jclingan

From what I recall, there were never discussions about whether MP compatibility did, or did not, require passing TCKs of specs that are part of the base. All that was defined was an implementation must past the TCK of all MicroProfile specifications in the platform

Sun Feb 09 19:38:15 +0000 2020

Replying to @reza_rahman

Actually it doesn‚Äôt. We never said Quarkus failed the CDI TCK

Sun Feb 09 19:51:40 +0000 2020

Replying to @reza_rahman

I‚Äôm saying we don‚Äôt intent to run Jakarta TCKs in Quarkus.

Sun Feb 09 20:24:34 +0000 2020

Replying to @m0mus, @jclingan, @alexsotob, @jtgreene, @reza_rahman, @javahippie, @Camunda, @QuarkusIO, @MicroProfileIO and @kwsutter

The truth is that no rules defined around requiring implementations to pass Java EE spec TCKs as they required a license.

Sun Feb 09 20:25:57 +0000 2020

Replying to @m0mus, @jtgreene, @reza_rahman, @jclingan, @alexsotob, @javahippie, @Camunda, @QuarkusIO, @MicroProfileIO and @kwsutter

Actually jars aren‚Äôt defined in MP either. MP is explicitly deployment agnostic in that sense

Sun Feb 09 20:27:35 +0000 2020

Replying to @struberg, @kjjaeger and @reza_rahman

No. It‚Äôs not required. We never defined MP compatibility as including running the TCKs of the base specs. As I mentioned before, at the time the license prevented broad use of them

Sun Feb 09 23:32:48 +0000 2020

Replying to @reza_rahman, @struberg and @kjjaeger

Documenting what? It was never discussed, so there‚Äôs nothing to document the non discussion

Sun Feb 09 23:38:10 +0000 2020

Replying to @reza_rahman, @struberg and @kjjaeger

It‚Äôs only ever been discussed in the passing MP TCK sense, nothing more

Sun Feb 09 23:40:58 +0000 2020

Replying to @struberg, @kjjaeger and @reza_rahman

It‚Äôs also worth noting that Hammock, one of the original MP implementors, would not have been able to run the base spec TCKs as it was a non vendor implementation

Sun Feb 09 23:42:02 +0000 2020

Replying to @kjjaeger, @struberg and @reza_rahman

Correct. There have only ever been test suites for each API spec. Never anything that crosses all specs

Mon Feb 10 00:21:22 +0000 2020

Replying to @reza_rahman, @struberg and @kjjaeger

It would only apply to MP 4.0 and beyond as MP 3.x is Java EE based

Mon Feb 10 00:21:58 +0000 2020

RT @kwsutter: @reza_rahman @jtgreene @m0mus @seamus_sullivan @kenfinnigan @javahippie @Camunda @QuarkusIO @MicroProfileIO So, is Quarkus Mi‚Ä¶

Mon Feb 10 15:01:24 +0000 2020

Replying to @arungupta

Congrats and all the best!

Mon Feb 10 16:19:43 +0000 2020

Replying to @m0mus, @kwsutter, @reza_rahman, @jtgreene, @seamus_sullivan, @javahippie, @Camunda, @QuarkusIO and @MicroProfileIO

That's not accurate. The only app server based impls of MP when it started were TomEE, Payara, and Websphere Liberty. WildFly Swarm, Hammock, and KumuluzEE were NOT app server based.

Mon Feb 10 16:27:23 +0000 2020

Replying to @m0mus, @kwsutter, @reza_rahman, @jtgreene, @seamus_sullivan, @javahippie, @Camunda, @QuarkusIO and @MicroProfileIO

Don't put words into my mouth. I was seeking to clarify your invalid statement around the original MP implementations. I wasn't commenting on anything else

Mon Feb 10 16:29:58 +0000 2020

Replying to @m0mus, @croft, @reza_rahman, @alexsotob, @l33tj4v4, @jorm08, @jtgreene, @jclingan, @javahippie, @Camunda, @QuarkusIO, @MicroProfileIO and @kwsutter

If you'd like to participate in the MP Architecture discussions where these decisions are made, then please join the community and get involved. It's very easy to poke holes in something from the outside.

Mon Feb 10 19:58:37 +0000 2020

Replying to @reza_rahman, @m0mus, @croft, @alexsotob, @l33tj4v4, @jorm08, @jtgreene, @jclingan, @javahippie, @Camunda, @QuarkusIO, @MicroProfileIO and @kwsutter

Yes there are often meetings where some discussion occurs. But everything for MP Architecture is driven asynchronously through GH Issues. If a decision happens to be made in a call, it will be announced to the appropriate issue, and we've often revisited it if someone disagrees

Mon Feb 10 20:04:30 +0000 2020

Replying to @reza_rahman, @m0mus, @croft, @alexsotob, @l33tj4v4, @jorm08, @jtgreene, @jclingan, @javahippie, @Camunda, @QuarkusIO, @MicroProfileIO and @kwsutter

So please don't disparage how things might work without actually investigating them

Mon Feb 10 20:05:01 +0000 2020
